description: Jim puts Dwight's stapler in Jell-O.
Jim moves Dwight's desk into the men's restroom.
Jim puts Dwight's desk items into the vending machine.
Jim slowly increases the weight of Dwight's phone handset with nickels, then removes them all at once so Dwight hits himself in the face.
Jim uses a 'Gaydar' detector on Dwight.
Jim sends faxes to Dwight from 'Future Dwight' warning him that the coffee is poisoned.
Jim conditions Dwight to expect an Altoid every time his computer reboots (Pavlov's Dog experiment).
Jim convinces Dwight that he is turning into a vampire.
Jim comes to work dressed as Dwight and mimics his mannerisms (Identity Theft).
Jim convinces Dwight that he bought 'Professor Copperfield's Miracle Legumes'.
Jim pairs his Bluetooth headset to Dwight's phone and answers his calls.
Jim gift-wraps Dwight's desk and chair; the chair collapses when Dwight sits on it.
Jim connects a red wire to Dwight's computer and runs it out the window and up a telephone pole.
Jim stacks his desk on top of another to create 'Quad Desk'.
Jim and Pam speak in Morse Code to convince Dwight he is being monitored.
Jim writes a fake book on 'Throwing a Garden Party' to trick Dwight into performing ridiculous rituals.
Jim fills Dwight's desk, chair, and cabinets with meatballs.
Jim and Pam hire an actor friend to pretend to be 'Asian Jim' and convince Dwight he has forgotten who Jim is.
Jim and the office create a fake radio interview to trick Dwight into thinking the Dunder Mifflin stock is plummeting.
